DOC.brief_summary: This descriptive study design evaluate propensity hospitalize pediatric patient treat adequately Clinolipid standard care 90 day develop Essential Fatty Acid Deficiency ( EFAD ) . Additionally , study design evaluate safety efficacy use Clinolipid pediatric population .
DOC.brief_title: Pediatric Study Evaluate Risk Developing Essential Fatty Acid Deficiency When Receiving Clinolipid Standard-of-Care Lipid Emulsion
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients and/or legal representative must able understand study voluntarily sign ICF 2 . Patients age < 18 year 3 . Patients able adhere protocol requirement 4 . Patients expect require PN least 7 day 5 . Premature infant ( < 36 week gestation ) require least 80 % PN meet nutrition requirement study entry ; full term infant child require least 70 % PN meet nutrition requirement study entry 1 . Patients expect survive hospitalization severe illness foreseeable intercurrent event could jeopardize patient 's participation study 2 . Patients know hypersensitivity lipid emulsion , egg soybean protein , active substance , excipients , component container 3 . Patients diagnosis shock , renal failure require dialysis , severe metabolic acidosis ( eg , pH < 7.10 , serum bicarbonate level â‰¤15 mEq/L , and/or Anion Gap > 16 mEq/L ) 4 . Patients hemodynamic instability judge Investigator 5 . Patients uncorrected metabolic disorder ( eg , diabetes ) liver disease include cholestasis 6 . Patients severe hyperlipidemia severe disorder lipid metabolism characterize hypertriglyceridemia ( triglyceride > 400 mg/dL ) 7 . Patients unable tolerate necessary laboratory monitoring 8 . Patients new active infection ( assessed investigator ) time initiation study treatment 9 . Patients enrol another clinical trial involve investigational agent 10 . Patients treat IV lipid within 48 hour randomization study
DOC.keyword: Parenteral Nutrition Associated Liver Disease ( PNALD )
Intestinal Failure Associated Liver Disease ( IFALD )
